page.title: 04Church-Memorial Window
page.content: One of the windows in the north wall of the church of St. Mary's, Fryerning, is a stained-glass memorial window to Sir Airey Neave. In 1979, Airey Neave, M.P. for Abingdon, was killed by a car bomb and , in his memory Penelope Neave, a relative, designed and made the window. The Neave family has lived in nearby Ingatestone for several generations. The window consists of two 8 feet (2.4m) high lancets which show different aspects of Airey Neave's life and character. One side shows St. Michael beating the devil, with a central medallion of Colditz, the prison from which Airey Neave escaped during the 2nd World War. The other side shows St. Christopher carrying the Christ child, with a central medallion of the Houses of Parliament.
